title: Rate law for persulfate and iodide reaction

content.description: <math alttext="S 2 O 8 with a negative 2 charge aqueous plus 3 I with a negative 1 charge aqueous, react to produce 2 S O 4 with a negative 2 charge aqueous plus I 3 with a negative 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: In aqueous solution, the reaction represented by the balanced equation shown above has the experimentally determined rate law: <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of S 2 O 8 with a negative 2 charge, times the molar concentration of I with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>rate</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>=</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.If the concentration of <math alttext="the molar concentration of S 2 O 8 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math> is doubled while keeping <math alttext=" the molar concentration of I with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> constant, which of the following experimental results is predicted based on the rate law, and why?

choices.label: The rate of reaction will remain the same, because <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will decrease by half.

The rate of reaction will double, because the rate is directly proportional to <math alttext="the molar concentration of S 2 O 8 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math>.

The rate of reaction will increase by a factor of four, because two moles of <math alttext="S O 4 with a negative 2 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> are produced for each mole of <math alttext="S 2 O 8 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> consumed.
The rate of reaction will increase by a factor of four, because the reaction is second order overall.

content.answer: The rate of reaction will double, because the rate is directly proportional to <math alttext="the molar concentration of S 2 O 8 with a negative 2 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[S</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></math>.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
